DOC.brief_summary: Dendritic cells (DC) play a key role in the pathogenesis of allergic diseases. The regulation of blood dendritic cells in patients with hymenoptera venom allergy before and during immune therapy is unknown.
DOC.brief_title: Regulation of Blood Dendritic Cells During Immune Therapy for Hymenoptera Venom Allergy
DOC.criteria: Patients with diagnosed hymenoptera venom allergy No previous treatments for hymenoptera venom allergy Treatment with immunosuppressive agents Any malignant disease Infections within 1 week prior to the initiation of the treatment
